app.routes package

Submodules

app.routes.driver module

class app.routes.driver.AddDriverResource[source]

Bases: Resource

Resource for adding a new driver.

Parameters:

Resource (class) – The base resource class.

Variables:

parser (RequestParser) – RequestParser instance for parsing request data.

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Collection[str] | None] = {'POST'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.

parser = <flask_restful.reqparse.RequestParser object>
post() → Response[source]
Post:

Endpoint to create a new driver.

Returns:

A tuple containing the driver data as a dictionary, the status code 201, and the content type header as a dictionary, if the driver is successfully created.

A dictionary containing the error message and the status code 403, if the request fails due to an integrity error.

A dictionary containing the error message and the status code 400, if the request is invalid or contains incorrect data types.

class app.routes.driver.DriverEndPointsMapper(api: Api)[source]

class app.routes.driver.DriversResource[source]

Bases: Resource

This class represents a resource for managing drivers.

Methods: - get(driver_id: int) -> Response: Retrieves information about a specific driver. - delete(driver_id: int) -> Response: Deletes a specific driver. - patch(driver_id: int) -> Response: Updates information for a specific driver.

delete(driver_id: int) → Response[source]

Delete a driver by their ID.

Parameters:

driver_id – The ID of the driver to be deleted.

Returns:

A dictionary with a “message” key and a corresponding HTTP status code. - If the driver is found and successfully deleted, the message is “Driver has been deleted” and the status code is 200. - If the driver is not found, the message is “Driver not found” and the status code is 404.

get(driver_id: int) → Response[source]

Get driver information by driver ID.

Parameters:

driver_id (int) – The ID of the driver.

Returns:

The driver information as a dictionary and the response status code.

Return type:

tuple(dict, int)

methods: t.ClassVar[t.Collection[str] | None] = {'DELETE', 'GET', 'PATCH'}

The methods this view is registered for. Uses the same default (["GET", "HEAD", "OPTIONS"]) as route and add_url_rule by default.

patch(driver_id: int) → Response[source]

Update a driver record based on the provided driver ID.

Parameters:

driver_id (int) – The ID of the driver to update.

Returns:

The updated driver record.

Return type:

Response
